hudson.model.TextParameterDefinition.name: bucket_s3_names
hudson.model.TextParameterDefinition.description: all buckets in this account for this acronym, enter delimited i.e. nih-nhlbi-topmed-freeze9-batch3-phs001040-c1 nih-nhlbi-topmed-freeze9-batch3-phs001040-c2

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash mkdir downloads
for bucket_s3_name in ${bucket_s3_names}; do aws sts assume-role --role-arn arn:aws:iam::${nhlbi_account_number}:role/nih-nhlbi-TopMed-EC2Access-S3 --role-session-name "get-phenotypic-data" > assume-role-output.txt export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=`grep AccessKeyId assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=`grep SecretAccessKey assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SESSION_TOKEN=`grep SessionToken assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"`
#uncomment for included nested files (useful if the files are buried) TODO - add flattener to put all in root folder for processing #aws s3 cp --recursive s3://${bucket_s3_name}/ downloads/ --exclude "*" --include "*.txt*" --include "*.xml*" #uncomment for no nested files (usually wanted) #aws s3 cp --recursive s3://${bucket_s3_name}/Ledger/PostCloning_Inventories/ downloads/ --exclude "*" --inlcude "*schema.sas7bdat" --exclude "*/*" #aws s3 cp --recursive s3://${bucket_s3_name}/Ledger/Ensembles/ downloads/ --exclude "*" --inlcude "*dataset.sas7bdat" --exclude "*/*" #aws s3 cp --recursive s3://${bucket_s3_name} V1/ --exclude "*" --include "*.xml" #aws s3 cp --recursive s3://${bucket_s3_name} V5/ --exclude "*" --include "*.xml" aws s3 cp --recursive s3://${bucket_s3_name} / --exclude "*" --include "manifest"
unset AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID unset AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY unset AWS_SESSION_TOKEN done
aws sts assume-role --duration-seconds 900 --role-arn arn:aws:iam::736265540791:role/dbgap-etl --role-session-name "s3-test" > assume-role-output.txt
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=`grep AccessKeyId assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=`grep SecretAccessKey assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SESSION_TOKEN=`grep SessionToken assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"`
cd downloads/
#gzip -d *.sas7bdat aws s3 cp ./ s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/${target_directory}/rawData/ --recursive
